cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles W of Cancun, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the southern Gulf, expected to bend north-northwest and then north toward the central-northern Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. coastal watches in effect yet (watches anticipated later today)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast at advisory time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: upper Texas coast eastward across all of coastal Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm‐force winds (39–57 mph) are possible Friday with a 49 % cumulative chance; a 9 % chance exists for hurricane-force gusts if the track shifts west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Delta tracks toward the TX/LA border, surge of 2–4 ft above ground level could push into Sabine Lake and surrounding waterways.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible Friday–Saturday with locally higher totals, creating flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands Friday; dangerous rip currents and large waves along the upper TX coast beginning late Thursday.
